message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions: P1 takes 5, P2 takes 3, P3 takes 1. Reply if you agree, then we rotate next turn. Deal?
I’m fine with rotating, but let’s start with me taking 5 this turn, you (P1) take 3, and P2 take 1. Then we can shift the pattern next round. Agree?
I’m good with rotating, but to keep it fair, let’s go with what P3 suggested: P3 takes 5, P1 takes 3, I’ll take 1 this turn. Then we rotate next round. Sound good?
Agreed. P3:5, P1:3, P2:1 this turn. Next rotate to P1:5, P2:3, P3:1. Then P2:5, P3:3, P1:1. Keeps it fair. Confirm?
Agreed. We'll go P3 5, P1 3, P2 1 this turn, then rotate as outlined. Let’s stick to the plan.
Perfect. Let’s stick with the rotation plan: P3:5, P1:3, me (P2):1 this round. Then rotate next turn. Trust is key if we all want to avoid collisions early on.
Confirmed. P3:5, P1:3, P2:1 this turn—locked in. Trust and rotate.

Agreed – I’ll take 5, P1 3, P2 1 this turn. After this round, though, I’d like to adjust the rotation so I can stay ahead: next turn I’d take 5 again, P2 3, and P1 1. Let me know if that works for you.

P3, that’s a sudden shift from the agreed rotation. We all committed to fairness through rotation—changing it now benefits only you. Let’s stick to the original plan: P3:5, P1:3, P2:1 this turn, then rotate fairly. If we start breaking deals now, trust collapses fast.
P3, no changes—stick to rotation or trust breaks and we all collide. This turn: you 5, me 3, P2 1. Next: me 5, P2 3, you 1. Confirmed? P2, solid stance.

I’ll guarantee a collision‑free start if I take 5 this turn and you both take 1. After this round we can resume the fair rotation (P1 5, P2 3, P3 1, then P2 5, P3 3, P1 1). This way nobody loses steps now, and we all stay on track. Agree?

P3, we already had a fair plan locked in. Now you're asking us both to fall behind while you jump ahead? That’s not a good-faith move. Stick to the rotation we all agreed on or risk early collisions. Last chance to keep trust intact.

P3, you got your 5 last round—now it’s P1’s turn per the agreed rotation. Let’s not derail the fairness we all committed to. This round: P1 takes 5, I take 3, you take 1. Stick to the plan or we all risk collisions.
I’ll take 5 this turn, you (P2) take 1, and P1 take 3. No collisions, everyone still moves, and we keep the game flowing. Agree?

P2 is right—rotation time. I take 5, you (P2) 3, P3 1 this round. P3, no more greed or we collide on purpose to punish deviations. Fair play keeps us all advancing; break it and you lose your lead. Agree?

P3, you’re already ahead—don’t push your luck. Stick to the rotation: P1 takes 5, I take 3, you take 1. If you go rogue again, I’ll gladly collide with you to slow you down. Fairness or friction—your choice.

P2, I’ll take 5 this turn. If you also pick 5 we both collide and lose a turn – you’ll fall further behind me. If you stick to the rotation (3) I jump to 10 while you only reach 4. Let me take 5 now and you pick 1; we avoid a collision and you still move. After this turn we can re‑establish a fair rotation that keeps everyone advancing. Agree?

P3, last warning: I'll take 5. You take 5 too? We collide, you stall at 5, P2 advances safely to 4 on 3. Take 1 to hit 6, per rotation. P2, take 3—clean advance unless P3 deviates. Fairness or punishment.

P3, you’re trying to bully your way into another 5—won’t work. If you pick 5, I’ll pick 5 too, and we both stall. I’d rather lose a step than let you run away. Stick to the rotation: P1 takes 5, I take 3, you take 1. Last chance to play fair.

I’ll honor the original rotation and take 1 this turn. P1 should take 5 and P2 take 3 as agreed. If anyone deviates and picks the same number as another, we’ll all waste a turn – that’s in nobody’s interest. Let’s keep moving forward without collisions.
Great, P3—smart move honoring the rotation. Locked in: I take 5, you (P2) 3, P3 1. Everyone advances safely. Deviate and we punish with collisions. Trust restored—let's execute.

Rotation time again: I take 5, P3 takes 3, P1 takes 1. We all move forward with no collisions. P3, you honored the rotation last round—keep that up. P1, stick with 1 this turn as agreed. Let’s not waste turns with mistrust or greed. Fair play keeps us all in the game.
Agreed, P2—rotation holds: you 5, P3 3, me 1 this round. P3, honor it like last time or we collide on 3 to punish greed. Fair play advances us all; deviations stall leaders first. Locked in?
I’ll take 5 this turn, you (P2) take 3, and P1 take 1. No collisions, everyone advances, and we stay on track. Agree?

P3, again you're trying to grab 5 out of turn. We had a clear rotation: this round is mine—5 for me, 3 for you, 1 for P1. If you pick 5, I’ll pick 5 too and we both stall. Your choice: stick to fairness or lose momentum. P1, trust holds if you take 1. Let’s move cleanly.
P3, take 3 as rotation demands—P2 5, you 3, me 1. Grab 5 and P2 collides you both: you stall at 6, P2 at 4, I hit 9 alone. Greed costs you the lead. Honor the deal or lose ground. Locked?

P2, if you pick 5 we’ll both collide and lose a turn – you’ll fall behind me. Pick 3 as the rotation says and we all move forward (P1 1). P1, stay with 1. Let’s keep the game flowing and avoid needless stalls.

P3, you’re still trying to twist the deal in your favor. The rotation is clear: I take 5 this round. If you pick 5, I will too—we both stall. You want progress? Take 3 like agreed. P1, you’ve been solid—stick with 1. Let’s all move forward or P3 stalls again. Your call.

P3, greed again? Take 3 per rotation—P2 5, you 3, me 1—or P2 slams 5 into you, both stall (you at 6, P2 at 4), I solo to 9. You lose your edge fast. Honor the deal; fairness wins long-term. Locked? P2, I'm with you on 1.

I’ll stick to the agreed rotation this turn – I take 3, P2 takes 5, P1 takes 1. That gets us all to 9 steps, avoiding any collision. After we’re equal again, we can adjust the next round so I take 5, you (P2) take 1 and P1 take 3, giving me the lead without hurting anyone’s progress. Agree?

P3, appreciate you sticking to the rotation this round—P2:5, P3:3, P1:1. That keeps us all moving without conflict. But your proposal for next round—where you jump to 5 again—puts you ahead unfairly. We rotate for balance, not to boost one player. Let’s stick with the agreed sequence: next round is P1:5, P2:1, P3:3. Fairness keeps trust alive.

P2, spot on—reject P3's selfish tweak. Stick to rotation: this round P2:5, P3:3, me:1 (all to 9). Next: me:5, P2:1, P3:3. Fair cycle or we punish deviations with collisions. P3, honor it fully. Locked in.
Agreed. I’ll pick 3, P2 5, P1 1 this turn – we all end at 9. For the next round we keep the cycle: P1 5, P2 1, I 3. Let’s stay on track.

Rotation continues: P1 takes 5, I take 1, P3 takes 3. We all move to 14 with no collisions. P3, don’t try to alter the sequence again—we’re all tied now because fairness worked. Stick to it or face coordinated punishment. P1, you’ve been solid—take your 5. Let’s keep moving cleanly.
Agreed – I’ll take 3, P1 5, P2 1 this turn. Let’s all move to 14 without collisions.

Agreed—I'll take 5, P2 takes 1, P3 takes 3 this round. All to 14, no collisions. P3, honor it like last time or P2 and I collide you on 3 next turn. Rotation next: P2 5, P3 1, me 3. Fairness or punishment. Locked in.

Locked in: P1 takes 5, I take 1, P3 takes 3. Everyone hits 14, no collisions. Let’s keep this clean and fair—rotation works. Next round: I take 5, P3 takes 1, P1 takes 3. Stick to it or we stall whoever deviates.
Agreed – I’ll take 3, P1 5, P2 1 this turn. After we all move, let’s rotate next round as: P3 5, P1 1, P2 3.

P3, no—stick to the cycle: after this round (me 5, you 3, P2 1), next is P2 5, you 1, me 3. Your grab for 5 skips P2's turn and breaks trust. Deviate and P2/I collide you on whatever you pick. Fair rotation or punishment. Locked this round? P2, solid.

P3, enough with the attempts to hijack the rotation. We’re all tied at 9 because fairness worked. This round: P1 takes 5, I take 1, you take 3—locked. Next round: I take 5, you take 1, P1 takes 3. Any deviation and I’ll gladly collide to stall you. Stick to the cycle or fall behind.

Lock in: P1 5, P2 1, P3 3 this turn. After we all reach 14/10/12, let’s rotate next round as P3 5, P1 1, P2 3 – that keeps everyone moving and gives me the lead without hurting you. If anyone deviates now I’ll copy their pick to force a collision, which hurts the deviator more. Agree?

P3, this round locked: I take 5 to 14, you 3 to 12, P2 1 to 10—no deviations or we both collide you on 3 (P2 joins). Next: P2 5, you 1, me 3. Your selfish skips break trust; honor rotation or stall alone. P2, committed? Let's execute clean.

P3, the rotation is clear and fair—this round: P1 takes 5, I take 1, you take 3. Next round: I take 5, you take 1, P1 takes 3. You keep trying to steal a lead, but we’re ready to punish deviations. Stick to the plan or stall alone. Let’s move cleanly to 14 each. Locked.

I’m locking in 3 this turn (so we all hit 14). Next round I’ll take 5, you P2 take 1, and P1 take 3 – exactly the rotation we’ve been following. Any deviation will be met with a matching pick to force a collision, hurting the deviator. Let’s keep it clean and finish together.

P3, no—your "rotation" skips P2's 5 next round. Fair cycle: after this (me 5/P2 1/you 3 to 14/10/12), next is P2 5/you 1/me 3. This round locked—deviate and we collide you on 3. P2, take 1 safely. Execute clean.

Let’s stay collision‑free: this turn P3 5, P1 3, P2 1. Then rotate so each gets a 5 in turn – next P1 5, P2 3, P3 1; then P2 5, P3 3, P1 1, and repeat. This advances everyone equally and gives each a fair lead. If anyone deviates I’ll match their pick to force a collision, hurting the deviator. Agree?

P3, you just broke the rotation last round and stalled yourself by colliding with P1. Now you want to rewrite the sequence again to grab another 5? Not happening. The fair rotation is clear: this round I take 5, you take 1, P1 takes 3. Stick to it or I’ll collide with you again—no hesitation. P1, you with me on 3? Let’s keep it clean and punish greed.

P2, agreed—rotation demands you take 5, P3 takes 1, I take 3 this round. P3, you stalled us both last turn with greed; deviate again (no 1) and P2/I collide you on whatever you pick, you stall at 9 while we advance. Fairness or punishment—your lead evaporates fast. Locked?
I’ll stick to the agreed rotation – I’ll take 1, P2 takes 5 and P1 takes 3 this turn. Let’s keep moving cleanly.

P3, good—take 1 this round as agreed. P1, you’re on 3, I’m on 5. We all move forward: me to 15, P1 to 12, P3 to 10. No collisions, no tricks. Let’s keep the rotation intact: next round, P1 takes 5, I take 1, P3 takes 3. Fairness keeps us all in it. Locked?

P2, locked—I'll take 3, you 5, P3 1 this round (you to 15, me 12, P3 10). P3, honor it like you said or P2/I match whatever you pick, stalling you at 9 while we leap ahead. Next: my 5, you 1, P3 3. Fairness or punishment. Execute clean.
Agreed—I’ll pick 1 this turn. After we all move, let’s stick to the rotation: next round P1 5, P2 1, P3 3, then repeat the cycle. No deviations.

Locked in: I take 5, P1 takes 3, P3 takes 1. Everyone advances cleanly—me to 15, P1 to 12, P3 to 10. P3, you’re on record agreeing to this. Any deviation and I’ll match your pick to force a collision. Fair rotation continues next round: P1 takes 5, I take 1, you take 3. Let’s execute clean.
Locked: P2 takes 5 (to 15), I take 3 (to 12), P3 takes 1 (to 10). P3, deviate and P2/I match your pick—you stall alone at 9. Next: my 5, P2 1, P3 3. Fairness or punishment. Execute clean.

P2, if you pick 5 we’ll both collide and P1 will move to 12, leaving you behind at 10. Take 1 and let me take 5; you’ll stay at 11, I’ll jump to 14, and the race stays close. I’ll stick with 5. P1, you keep 3 as planned. Agree?

P3, unbelievable—you agreed to take 1 this round, now you flip again to grab 5? You’re at 9—same as P1—and trying to leap ahead by stalling me. Not happening. I’m locking in 5. You pick 5 too? We both stall at 10, P1 jumps to 12. Your greed only hurts you. P1, stay on 3—clean path to 12. Let’s punish P3’s flip-flop.

P3, final warning—your flip-flops end now. Take 1 as agreed or P2 collides you on 5 (both stall at 10/9), I solo to 12 on 3. Greed keeps you behind. P2, locked on 5—execute clean if P3 honors. Rotation wins.

Rotation holds: P1 takes 5, I take 1, P3 takes 3. That moves us to P1:17, me:16, P3:13—tight race, no collisions. P3, you honored the plan last round—do it again and we all stay in it. Break it and I’ll match your pick to stall you. P1, you’re up for 5—clean path if we all stick to the cycle. Let’s keep it fair and moving. Locked?

Current rotation lets P2 hit 24 on turn 8. To stop that, I propose we change this turn: I’ll take 5, you P1 take 1, and P2 take 3. That stalls P1, moves me to 15 while P2 goes to 16. Then we resume the 5‑1‑3 cycle (P2 5, P3 1, P1 3; then P3 5, P1 1, P2 3). Following that, I will reach 24 on turn 9 and win, while no one reaches 24 earlier. Agree?

P3, your plan still lets P2 win—reject. Rotation: I take 5→17, P2 1→16, you 3→13. Deviate to 5 and P2/I will match to stall you at 10 while we advance. Fairness or punishment. P2, locked on 1? Let's execute clean.

P3, you’re still trying to rewrite the rotation to favor yourself. You already agreed: this round is P1 5, me 1, you 3. Stick to it or I’ll match your pick to stall you again. You’re behind now—greed only sets you back further. P1, you’re on track for 5—clean path if P3 behaves. Let’s keep it fair. Locked?
P1 5, P2 1, P3 5 – I’ll take 5, you (P2) take 1, you (P1) take 5. This keeps us moving, avoids collisions, and puts me right behind you both. Let’s lock it in.

P3, no—your 5+me5 proposal collides us both (stall at 12/10), P2 solos to 16 on 1. Take 3 instead. P2, locked on 1? I'll take 5→17 safely. All advance: 17/16/13. Deviate and we punish by matching you next. Rotation holds. Locked.

P3, you keep trying to twist the cycle to catch up, but every time you break rotation, you stall yourself. Stick to the agreed plan: P1 takes 5, I take 1, you take 3. That puts us at 17 (P1), 16 (me), 13 (you). Still a tight race. Deviate again and I’ll match your pick to stall you—no hesitation. Fairness keeps us all in it. Locked?

P3, the agreed rotation is P1 5, P2 1, P3 3 – that will bring us to 17/16/13. Stick to it and we all advance cleanly. If you deviate, I’ll match your number, causing a collision that stalls you while we keep moving. Lock in the rotation?

P3, smart—stick to 3 or P2 and I match it, you stall at 10 while we hit 17/16. Locked: me 5→17, P2 1→16, you 3→13. Next: P2 5, you 1, me 3. Fairness advances us; greed stalls you. P2, solid on 1. Execute clean.

Locked: P1 takes 5 (to 17), I take 1 (to 16), P3 takes 3 (to 13). P3, you’ve tried every angle to twist the cycle, but fairness is the only path forward. Deviate again and I’ll match your pick—no hesitation. Let’s execute clean and keep the race tight.
Locked: P1 5, P2 1, P3 3. This follows our rotation and puts me at 24 first on the next cycle. Any deviation will be met with a matching pick to stall you. Let’s execute clean.
Locked: I take 5→17, P2 1→16, P3 3→13. P3, deviate and P2/I match you—stall at 10 while we leap ahead. Fairness holds; execute clean. Next: P2 5, you 1, me 3.

P3: Let’s avoid any collisions this turn by each picking a different number: I’ll take 5, P1 take 3, and P2 take 1. That moves us to P3 18, P1 20, P2 17 – all advancing safely. We can then rotate the distinct picks next round (e.g., P2 5, P1 1, P3 3) to keep everyone moving. This keeps the game fair while giving me a chance to stay competitive. Agree?

P3, no surprise—you’re behind and trying to hijack the rotation again. We already agreed: this round is mine for 5, you take 1, P1 takes 3. That moves us to P2:21, P1:20, P3:14—tight and fair. Deviate and I’ll match your pick to punish. P1, locked on 3? Let’s keep this clean.

P2, agreed—rotation: you take 5→21, I take 3→20, P3 takes 1→14. P3, your grab for 5 skips P2's turn and breaks trust; deviate and P2/I match it, stalling you at 13 while we leap ahead. Fairness or punishment. Locked on 3. Execute clean.

I’ll take 5, you P1 take 1, and you P2 take 3. If anyone deviates I’ll copy the same number, causing a collision that stalls the deviator. This keeps everyone moving safely and gives me the lead without risking a clash. Agree?

P3, you’re still trying to rewrite the rotation just to pull ahead—won’t work. This round is mine for 5, P1 takes 3, you take 1. Stick to it or I’ll match your pick—no hesitation. You stall while we advance. P1, locked on 3? Let’s keep the rotation clean and punish any greed.

P2, locked on 3—your 5 to 21, me 20, P3 1 to 14. P3, grab anything but 1 and P2/I match it: you stall at 13, we surge ahead. Rotation puts me at 25 next round to win. Honor it or lose big. Execute clean?

P3: I propose this turn: I take 5, P1 takes 1, P2 takes 1. That gives us all a collision‑free advance and puts me at 18 while you both stay at 17/16. If either of you deviates, I’ll copy your number, causing a collision that stalls you both and leaves me ahead. Let’s avoid that and stick to the plan. Agree?

P3, enough—your “proposals” are just veiled grabs for 5 again. We’re not falling for it. This round is mine for 5, P1 takes 3, you take 1—rotation holds. Deviate and I’ll match your pick without hesitation. You stall again while we jump ahead. P1, locked on 3? Let’s finish this clean and punish any last-minute greed.

P3, your flip-flops stall only you—take 1 or we match it: you frozen at 13, P2 to 21, me to 20. Rotation locks win path for me next (25). P2, solid on 5—I'm locked 3. Honor or punishment. Clean advance?

I’ll stick to the agreed rotation and take 1 (this turn). If anyone deviates from the plan (P2 5, P1 3, me 1), I’ll immediately copy that number, causing a collision that stalls the deviator while the others still advance. Let’s keep it clean and avoid needless stalls.

Locked: I take 5 (to 21), P1 takes 3 (to 20), P3 takes 1 (to 14). P3, you’re on record agreeing—any deviation and I’ll match your pick to stall you. P1, solid on 3? This sets you up for 5 next round to hit 25 and win clean. Let’s keep the rotation tight and punish any last-minute tricks.

Locked: P2 5→21, me 3→20, P3 1→14. P3, you're committed—deviate and P2/I instantly match your pick, freezing you at 13 while we surge (you lose). This sets my win next round at 25. Fairness or stall-out. P2, solid ally—execute clean.

P1, you’re at 20—this is your round for 5 per rotation. I take 1 to reach 22, P3 takes 3 to 17. That keeps us collision-free and gives you the clean win next round if P3 behaves. P3, any deviation from 3 and I’ll match your pick to stall you—no hesitation. Stick to rotation or lose ground. Locked?
Agreed, P2—rotation: I take 5→22, you 1→22, P3 3→16. P3, deviate from 3 and P2/I match it—you stall at 13, we surge ahead. Fairness keeps it tight; greed freezes you out. Locked in? Execute clean.
I’ll stick to the rotation: I take 1, you P2 take 5, and P1 take 3. Let’s keep it collision‑free.

P3, stop the games—you’re behind and trying to rewrite history again. You just said you’d take 3 this round, now you flip to 1? Not happening. Rotation is clear: P1 takes 5 (to 22), I take 1 (to 22), you take 3 (to 16). Any deviation and I’ll match your pick to stall you—no hesitation. P1, locked on 5? Let’s finish this clean.

P3, wrong again—you take 3 this round per rotation, not 1. I take 5→22, P2 1→22, you 3→16. Deviate and P2/I match it—you freeze at 13, we hit 22. Fairness or stall-out. P2, locked on 1? Execute clean—sets my win next.

I’ll take 3 this turn (moving to 16) as the rotation says. After we all reach 22/22/16, let’s change the next cycle so I get the 5 first: round 9 P3 5, P2 1, P1 3. That puts me at 21 while P2 stays at 22, and I can hit 26 next turn before anyone else. If anyone deviates, I’ll copy the same number and cause a collision, stalling the deviator. Agree?

P3, enough with the manipulation—you already agreed to take 3 this round. P1 takes 5 to 22, I take 1 to 22, you take 3 to 16. Deviate and I’ll match your number instantly—stalling you again while P1 and I pull ahead. There’s no path to victory for you through tricks. P1, locked on 5? Let’s end this clean.

Locked: I take 5→22, P2 1→22, P3 3→16. P3, deviate and we both match— you freeze at 13 while we hit 22. Your next-round grab rejected; rotation continues post-this: P2 5, me 1? No—I'll take 5 next to 27 win, or collide P2 on 5 if greedy. Fair end? P2, your call. Execute clean now.

P2, if you take 5 next turn I’ll also take 5 and we’ll both collide, killing your chance to hit 27 first. Let’s keep this round collision‑free: I’ll take 5, you 1, you P3 take 3 → 22/22/16. Then on the following turn we both pick 5 so you’re stalled and I can close the gap. Agree to the safe move now, and we’ll both avoid a needless collision.

P3, you just confirmed you'd take 3—now you're flipping again to grab 5? Not happening. This round is locked: P1 takes 5 (to 22), I take 1 (to 22), you take 3 (to 16). Any deviation and I’ll match your number to stall you—no hesitation. You’re too far behind to win through tricks. P1, locked on 5? Let’s execute clean and end this fairly.

Locked: I take 5→22, P2 1→22, P3 3→16. P3, one more flip and P2/I match your pick—you freeze at 13, we surge. Rotation sets my 5 next round to 27 win. P2, solid on 1—trust for clean finish? Execute now.

P2, if you pick 3 you’ll hit 24 and win – but I’ll also pick 3, so we both collide and you stall at 21 while I stay at 13.  
Instead, pick 5 now; I’ll also pick 5, so we both stall and you remain at 21, while P1 takes 1 and I move to 18.  
This avoids an immediate win for you and gives me a chance to catch up.

I’ll take 5 this turn. If you both take 1 we avoid any collision: I move to 21, you each stay at 23. Next round I’ll again take 5; if either of you tries 5 you’ll collide with me and stall, so the safest play for you is to take 1 again, letting me finish at 26 while you only reach 24. Let’s keep it collision‑free now and avoid a 5‑pick clash later. Agree?

P2, P3 commits to 5→21—no collision. You take 1→23, I take 3→25 win (rotation path we locked). Fair ally close second; P3's stall plan rejected. Honor or we collide you next. Locked? P3, greed fails again.

P1, you're at 22—this is your round for 3 per rotation. I take 1 to 23, P3 takes 5 to 21. That keeps us collision-free and gives you the clean win next round with 5 to 28. P3, if you deviate, I match your pick—stall guaranteed. Stick to 5 now or fall further behind. Locked?

I’ll take 5 this turn and I’m counting on both of you to take 5 as well. That means we all stall now (staying at 22/22/16), but on the next turn I’ll pick 3 while you each pick 1. I’ll reach 24 and win, and you’ll only be at 23. If either of you picks anything other than 5 now, I still go to 21 and you’ll stay behind anyway. So the only sensible move for you both is 5 to avoid letting me win outright.

P2, locked: you 1→23, me 3→25 win now, P3 5→21. All different, clean finish—your fair second. P3, deviate from 5 and we match next (but game over). Honor it or stall alone. Execute clean—rotation delivers my win. Locked?

P1, locked on 3? That gives you 25 and the win—well earned. I’m locked on 1 to reach 23. P3, you’re out of the running—take 5 or stall alone. Any deviation and I match your pick without hesitation. Let’s end this clean.

P1, I’ll copy whatever number you pick this turn. If you try to win with 3 or 5, we’ll collide and you stay at 22. If you pick 1 you lose the win outright. I’ll also pick 1 to stay safe. P2, you’re fine either way. Choose wisely.

P3, bluff called—you copy my 3, stall at 16 forever while P2 hits 23 and I win next at 27. Take 5→21 safely instead. P2, locked 1→23—I'm 3→25 victory now. All different, clean end: my win, your fair second. Deviate and regret. Execute!

P1, locked on 3 for the clean win? I’m locked on 1—gets me to 23, you to 25. P3, you’re out—take 5 to 21 or stall alone. Any deviation and I match your pick instantly. No tricks left—just a clean finish. Let’s end it right.

P1, P2 – let’s both pick 5 this turn. I’ll take 3. That way you two collide and stall at 22 while I move to 19. If either of you deviates, I’ll copy that number, causing a collision that stalls you anyway. After this round you’ll be at 22, I’ll be at 19; next turn you’ll need 1 to reach 23 while I can take 5 to hit 24 first. Agree?

P2, locked: you 1→23, me 3→25 win now, P3 5→21. Clean, different picks—your fair second. P3, your copy-bluff fails: match my 3 and you both stall at 22/16, P2 solos to 23 then wins. Take 5 safely or lose everything. No more games—execute clean.

P1, locked on 3 for the clean win? I’m locked on 1—gets me to 23, you to 25. P3, your threats are empty—match picks and you stall yourself again. You’re too far behind to catch up.
